# **Meat Consumption: Poultry and Plotly**
I know I should have put a chicken as the pick to match the title but I mean come on look at this thing!
source.e268977a: I find this graph very interesting. We can start to isolate some interesting trends. if we highlight just the world columns we can see as a whole we are becoming much better fed even with the rising population our overall access to meat has grown tremendously. Yet this doesn't paint the entire picture. Just because the overall production is increasing doesn't mean that the resource is being equitably distributed.
source.b859b4bd: Thanks for reading this I'm still learning and appreciate any feedback!!
source.928f9eca: ## 1.Introduction Meat has long been a key economic indicator. It shows to a degree the prosperity of a nation. This consumable luxury good has a rather high resource demand in comparison to substitute goods. In this kernel, I will be exploring this relation of meat consumption over time and try and explain the visualizations with further research to have a better understanding of the country's history through the meat it produces.
source.4867d322:
1) Some ideas could be to create a column reversing the feed ratio. this could give us an idea of total resources being dedicated to meat production. this type of information could teach us quite a bit about this luxury good. if this is combined with food scarcity information you might be able to understand how a nation handles the care of its most vulnerable.

2) I also know about links between the rearing process of different animals and their subsequent freshwater demands which can be quite high when you take into account the water required to create their food. 

3) Could be interesting to separate the data into developed and developing nations to see how the trends have changed ****
source.9ec7d3ad: For those who have not used Plotly before you can double click on items in the legend to isolate them and repeat to return to normal. this graph shows two measurements per line in the legend. Say you isolate a variable. You will notice two dotted lines are shown the bottom is in KG per capita this is how much of that eat source people get per year. and the total output in thousands of tons or 'THND_TONNE'.
source.ec148a0d:
When looking on a global scale we see the largest rise in poultry, which nearly tripled, this could be due to the efficiency of the animal. Poultry production has a few things that could explain this boom. When looking at animal production feed conversion ratio is an important metric. This is the amount of food needed to increase the animal's weight by one. so the lower the ratio the better the animal is at growing. Chickens have a [feed conversion ratio of 1.6](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feed_conversion_ratio#:~:text=In%20animal%20husbandry%2C%20feed%20conversion,feed%20into%20the%20desired%20output.&text=FCR%20is%20the%20mass%20of,mass%20of%20milk%20or%20meat). This paired with the resource requirements of the small animal make it perfect for large scale and local production. we also see a large growth in pigs which are considered to have a fair to good [conversion ratio of 3.8-4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feed_conversion_ratio#:~:text=In%20animal%20husbandry%2C%20feed%20conversion,feed%20into%20the%20desired%20output.&text=FCR%20is%20the%20mass%20of,mass%20of%20milk%20or%20meat). Pigs also can eat from an extremely wide variety of sources making them easier to raise. They have been called a living [garbage disposal](https://www.washingtonian.com/2018/08/27/dc-used-to-feed-its-trash-to-pigs-whyd-we-stop/).

But this data is hard to read with the aggregate groups like BRICS (Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa) OECD (Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development) so let's separate these graphs.
source.4dc6f0b3: ### 1.1 Domain Informations Data Variable Descriptions * **LOCATION** = *the country code name* * **SUBJECT** = *The type of meat(pig, beef, etc)* * **TIME** = *the year the data was recorded* * **MEASURE** = *the measure used to show the value* * **KG_CAP**-*KG per person annually* * **THND_TONNE**- *annual consumption in thousands of tonnes* * **VALUE** = The value, according to the measure
